snippet: Starting next year, New York will become the first state to require unpaid work from lawyers seeking to practice here, a move intended to help people who cannot afford legal services.
abstract: New York will require lawyers to perform 50 hours of pro bono work before they are admitted to the New York State Bar, beginning in 2013; move is intended to help growing number of people who cannot afford legal services.
lead_paragraph: Starting next year, New York will become the first state to require unpaid work from lawyers seeking to practice here, a move intended to help people who cannot afford legal services.

headline.seo: New Lawyers in New York to Be Required to Do Some Work Free
headline.main: Top Judge Makes Free Legal Work Mandatory for Joining State Bar
